result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jonathan T. Boettcher

defendant.name: Boettcher, Jonathan T.
defendant.address: N10616 Deer Lake Rd., Athelstane, WI 54104

records.addlTxt:
Prosecuting attorney DeShea D. Morrow in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jonathan T. Boettcher in court.  Attorney Richard S Zoellner in court for Jonathan T. Boettcher. 
3:52 p.m.
Court calls 22CF147 and 22CF148.
Prelim Questionnaire/Waiver filed.
Court finds Deft freely waives prelim.
Deft bound over for trial.
Parties ready to proceed to arraignment.
Information will track complaint.
Waives reading.
Enters not guilty pleas.
DA heard on proposed signature bond for 22CF147.
Atty Zoellner agrees.
Court orders signature bond w/conditions as stated.
4:00 p.m.
Status conference scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Cash bond conditions modified- No Contact with Victim D.B. is removed- Cash posted 6-3-22.

8:32 AM Prosecuting attorney DeShea D. Morrow in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jonathan T. Boettcher in court.  Attorney Richard S Zoellner in court for Jonathan T. Boettcher. 
Court calls case. 
Copy of complaint. 
Maximum penalties and charges. 
Waivers formal reading. 
Requests Prelim. 
Atty spks on Motion to Modify Bond Motion- Requests that the No contact with father be removed. 
Victim D.B. spks.
Has completed services with Rainbow House. 
DA responds. 
Court grants request to Modify Bond- lifts the no contact with D.B. 
Court schedules with parties. 
8:37 AM
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 03:45 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Dean Appt Atty. Zoellner Repayment $125/month commencing 06/01/2022

1:20 PM Defendant Jonathan T. Boettcher appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney DeShea D. Morrow in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court calls case.
Copy of Criminal Complaint.
Court reviews charges and maximum penalties.
Court inquires on Atty.
Deft heard has a dean appointed attorney in Br 2 and will be requesting a dean appointment for this case as well.
DA heard on bond recommendations.
Deft heard.
Court imposes $5,000 cash bail w/ conditions; sign waiver of extradition, no consumption of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid Rx, no contact with D.B., must take all prescribed medications and only as prescribed by health care providers. 
Deft to contact the Public Defender's office today.
Court schedules with parties.
1:26 PM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
